items.sentence: I wish I could speak French well enough to get a job at that company.
Tom bought three bottles of red wine and three bottles of white wine.
Tom likes making faces at children when their parents aren't looking.
I think you know that Tom isn't going to do that unless you help him.
I'm still in Australia, but I'll be back home the day after tomorrow.
I don't charge children as much for piano lessons as I charge adults.
Tom put on his mask, gloves and face shield before leaving the house.
Tom played the role of devil's advocate at the brainstorming meeting.
Tom kept dropping subtle hints about what he wanted for his birthday.
Tom went to school even though his doctor told him that he shouldn't.
I was on the point of leaving home when a light rain started to fall.
The man who I thought was his father proved to be a perfect stranger.
They accused him of being in the classroom in order to cause trouble.
The ground is still wet. As likely as not, the game will be canceled.
I agreed with her suggestion that we meet again five years from then.
Even if the sun were to rise in the west, I would not change my mind.
The rumor is going around that the actress is going to get a divorce.
When I was a child, my mother made me eat green vegetables every day.
Knowing what to leave out is as important as knowing what to include.
Tom always pays his credit card bill in full at the end of the month.
